Question
========

Below is a table showing the number of moons for each planet in our solar system. You are given three different randomly chosen planets of which you have to make a description of the moons of those three planets are to make a description of. What then is the minimum and maximum of the number of moons you have to describe? \

  ----------- -------------- planet number of moons Mercury 0 Venus 0 Earth 1 Mars 2 Jupiter 63 Saturn 56 Uranus 27 Neptune 13 ----------- --------------

Answerlist
----------

* The smallest number is 0 and the largest is 63.
* The smallest number is 1 and the largest is 63.
* The smallest number is 1 and the largest is 146.
* The smallest number is 1 and the largest is 162.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* The smallest number is 0 and the largest is 63...: Incorrect
* The smallest number is 1 and the largest is 63...: Incorrect
* The smallest number is 1 and the largest is 146...: Correct
* The smallest number is 1 and the largest is 162.:Incorrect
